name: Hydrilla

Identifying Characteristics: Stems: monoecious variety â€“ branch at lake bottom; doecious variety branch at water surface
Leaves: green, lance-shaped with claw-like serrations along outer margin, in whorls of 4-8; lower leaves may be in opposite of in whorls of 3
Flowers: to late summer, small white mid, rise to surface on slender stalks from upper leaf axils
Fruits/Seeds: small, spindle-shaped, 5-6mm long, rarely seen
Other: spiny green turions form in leaf axils
Biology: Reproduction by seed thought to be low relative to other methods
Habitat: Wide variety of environmental conditions: varied substrate, still or flowing water, low or high nutrients, low light
Tolerates salinities up to 10 parts per thousand
Range: Northeast US Range: Maine, Connecticut, Massachusetts, New Jersey
Native Range: Africa, Australia, parts of Asia

tags: plants with blade-shaped leaves on stems
